gurmukhi: ਪਪੱਕ ਪੱਖਰੇ ਤੁਰੇ ਭਭੱਖ ਘਾੲਿ ਨਿਰਮਲੰ || ਪਲੁੱਥ ਲੁੱਥ ਬਿੱਥਰੀ ਅਮੱਥ ਜੁੱਥ ੳੁੱਥਲੰ ||੩੦੮||
transliteration: Papakk Pakdare Ture Bhabhakkh Ghaae Nirmalan|| Paloutth Loutth Bitthariamatth Joutth Outthalan||308||
translation: The horses vied with one another in speed and the pure blood gushed out of the wounds. In the turmoil of the war, the corpses rolling in dust, scattered hither and thither.308.

gurmukhi: ਅਜੁੱਥ ਲੁੱਥ ਬਿੱਥਰੀ ਮਿਲੰਤ ਹੱਥ ਬੱਖਯੰ || ਅਘੁੱਮ ਘਾੲਿ ਘੁੱਮ ੲੇ ਬਬੱਕ ਬੀਰ ਦੁੱਧਰੰ ||
transliteration: Ajoutth Loutth Bittharimilant Hatth Bakkhayan|| Aghoumm Ghaae Ghoumm E Babakk Beer Duddhran||
translation: Because of the blows of the sword being stuck on the waists, the corpses were scattered and the warriors, turning with difficulty, began to strike bows with double-edged dagger.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਲੰ ਕਰੰਤ ਖੱਪਰੀ ਪਿਪੰਤ ਸ੍ਰੋਣ ਪਾਣਯੰ || ਹਹੱਕ ਭੈਰਵੰ ਸ੍ਰੁਤੰ ੳੁਠੰਤ ਜੁੱਧ ਜ੍ਵਾਲਯੰ ||੩੦੯||
transliteration: Kilan Karant Khapparipipant Sron Paanayan|| Hahakk Bhairavan Sroutan Outhant Juddh Jvaalayan||309||
translation: The Yoginis while shrieking, and taking the blood in their hands began to drink it; the Bhairvas roamed themselves in the field and the fires of war blazed.309.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਕੰਤ ਫਿੰਕਤੀ ਫਿਰੰ ਰੜੰਤ ਗਿੱਧ ਬ੍ਰਿੱਧਣੰ || ਡਹੱਕ ਡਾਮਰੀ ੳੁਠੰ ਬਕਾਰ ਬੀਰ ਬੈਤਲੰ ||
transliteration: Phikant Phinkatiphiran Radant Giddh Briddhanan|| Dahakk Daamariouthan Bakaar Beer Baitlan||
translation: The jackals and big vultures roamed in the battlefield hither and thither; the vampires bellowed and the Baitals (ghosts) raised their shrill voice.

gurmukhi: ਖਹੱਤ ਖੱਗ ਖੱਤ੍ਰੀਯੰ ਖਿਮੰਤ ਧਾਰ ੳੁੱਜਲੰ || ਘਣੰਕ ਜਾਣ ਸਾਵਲੰ ਲਸੰਤ ਬੇਗ ਬਿੱਜੁਲੰ ||੩੧੦||
transliteration: Khahatt Khagg Khattreeyan Khimant Dhaar Ujjalan|| Ghanank Jaan Saavalan Lasant Beg Bijjulan||310||
translation: The white-edged dagger in the hands of the Kshatriyas (Ram and Lakshman) was well-placed in their hands like the lightning in the dark clouds.310.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਪੰਤ ਸ੍ਰੋਣ ਖੱਪਰੀ ਭਖੰਤ ਮਾਸ ਚਾਵਡੰ || ਹਕਾਰ ਵੀਰ ਸੰਭਿੜੈ ਲੁਝਾਰ ਧਾਰ ਦੁੱਧਰੰ ||
transliteration: Pipant Sron Khapparibhakhannddmaas Chaavadan|| Hakaar Veer Sanbhidai Lujhaar Dhaar Duddhran||
translation: The Yoginis with the bowls were drinking blood and the kites were eating flesh, the warriors keeping control of their double-edged spears were fighting, while shouting at their companions.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਕਾਰ ਮਾਰ ਕੈ ਪਰੇ ਸਹੰਤ ਅੰਗ ਭਾਰਯੰ || ਬਿਹਾਰ ਦੇਵ ਮੰਡਲੰ ਕਟੰਤ ਖੱਗ ਧਾਰਯੰ ||੩੧੧||
transliteration: Pipant Sron Khapparibhakhannddan Bhaaryan|| Bihaar Dev Mandalan Katant Khagg Dhaaryan||311||
translation: They were shouting “kill, kill” and bearing the burden of their weapons, some warriors were there in the cities of gods (i.e. they had died) and some are chopping other warriors.311.

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰਚਾਰ ਵਾਰ ਪੈਜ ਕੈ ਖੁਮਾਰ ਘਾੲਿ ਘੂਮਹੀ || ਤਪੀ ਮਨੋ ਅਧੋ ਮੁਖੰ ਸੁ ਧੂਮ ਅਾਗ ਧੂਮ ਹੀ ||
transliteration: Prachaar Vaar Paij Kai Khoumaar Ghaae Ghoom-hee|| Tapimano Adho Moukhanndsu Dhoom Aag Dhoom Hee||
translation: The warriors, hurling their blows, were roaming in intoxication like the ascetics performing austerities and swinging with their faces bent downward over the smoke;

gurmukhi: ਤੁਟੰਤ ਅੰਗ ਭੰਗਯੰ ਬਹੰਤ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਧਾਰਯੰ || ੳੁਠੰਤ ਛਿੱਛ ੲਿੱਛਯੰ ਪਿਪੰਤ ਮਾਸ ਹਾਰਯੰ ||੩੧੨||
transliteration: Toutant An Bhanyan Bahan Astra Dhaarayng|| Outhant Chhichchh Ichchhyan Maas Haaryan||312||
translation: There is flow of arms and the broken limbs were falling down, the waves of the desire of victory are rising and the chopped flesh is falling.312.

gurmukhi: ਅਘੋਰ ਘਾੲਿ ਅੱਘੲੇ ਕਟੇ ਪਰੇ ਸੁ ਪ੍ਰਾਸਨੰ || ਘੁਮੰਤ ਜਾਣ ਰਾਵਲੰ ਲਗੇ ਸੁ ਸਿੱਧ ਅਾਸਣੰ ||
transliteration: Aghor Ghaae Agghae Kate Dare Su Prasanan|| Ghoumant Jaan Raavalan Lage Su Siddh Aasanan||
translation: The Aghori (Sadhus) seem pleased in eating the chopped limbs and the Siddhas and Rawalpanthis, the devourers of flesh and blood have taken seats with postures;

gurmukhi: ਪਰੰਤ ਅੰਗ ਭੰਗ ਹੁੲਿ ਬਕੰਤ ਮਾਰ ਮਾਰਯੰ || ਬਦੰਤ ਜਾਣ ਬੰਦੀਯੰ ਸੁਕ੍ਰਿਤ ਕ੍ਰਿਤ ਅਪਾਰਯੰ ||੩੧੩||
transliteration: Parant An Bhan Hue Bakant Maar Maaryan|| Badant Jaan Bandeeyan Soukrit Krit Apaaryan||313||
translation: Shouting “kill, kill” the warriors are falling with broken limbs and because of their bravery, they are being greeted.313.

gurmukhi: ਬਜੰਤ ਤਾਲ ਤੰਬੂਰੰ ਬਿਸੇਖ ਬੀਨ ਬੇਣਯੰ || ਮ੍ਰਿਦੰਗ ਝਾਲਨਾ ਫਿਰੰ ਸਨਾੲਿ ਭੇਰ ਭੈ ਕਰੰ ||
transliteration: Bajant Taal Tanbooran Bisekh Been Baanayan|| Mridan Dhaalanaa Phiran Sanaae Bher Bhai Karan||
translation: The special sound obstructing the blows on the shields is being heard, the mixed sound of the harp, flute, drum, kettle-drum etc. is creating a dreadful atmosphere.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਠੰਤ ਨਾਵਿ ਨਿਰਮਲੰ ਤੁਟੰਤ ਤਾਲ ਤੱਥਿਯੰ || ਬਦੰਤ ਕਿੱਤ ਬੰਦੀਅੰ ਕਬਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਕਾਬਯ ਕੱਥਿਯੰ ||੩੧੪||
transliteration: Outhant Naav(i) Nirmalan Toutant Taal Tatthiyan|| Badant Kitt Bandeean Kabindra Kaabya Katthiyan||214||
translation: The beautiful sounds also rearing the tunes of the blows of different kinds of weapons are arising in the battlefield, somewhere the servitors are busy in prayers and somewhere the poets are reciting their compositions.314.

gurmukhi: ਢਲੰਤ ਢਾਲ ਮਾਲਯੰ ਖਹੰਤ ਖਹੱਤ ਖੱਗ ਖੇਤਯੰ || ਚਲੰਤ ਬਾਣ ਤੀਛਣੰ ਅਨੰਤ ਅੰਤ ਕੰਕਯੰ ||
transliteration: Dhalant Dhaal Maalayan Khahant Khagg Khetayan|| Chalant Baan Teechhanan Anant Ant Kankayan||
translation: The sound of obstructing the shields and the sound of the striking swords are being heard and the sharp arrows destroying innumerable people are being discharged;
